column4: quick question: when you do the "make" "make install" commands for ndiswrapper, is it compiled to run on your architecture(amd64,ppc)?
Yes, so you will ALSO need WiNDOWS drivers for that arch.
So ppc would be useless, as is amd64 in most cases.
the amd64
if there are 64bit ones
They'll make typos.
which feels faster, the ppc or amd64?
then ia32, sure.
probably with blackdown (which is sun) but not with the gcc one
go and rerad the chroot url ubotu just posted.
In a chroot.
thx man... so I should run dchroot -d before starting right?
You can run dchroot -q -d /path/to/wine "C:\\\Program Files\\\Appdir\\\App.exe"
Note the triple backslash.
but that's after I install wine in chroot right?
indeed
thx! now let me get to work :)
sudo apt-get install wine
ubunbtuforms should not be used, as they give you bad info.
Pretty much, installing unpackged software is  abad idea.
so doing a 'sudo apt-get wine' on chroot will get all of that done?
that will install wine, yes.
